ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this to a student who is open to a relatively unconventional class structure. I really loved this aspect of the class, but I sense that it might have caused other classmates to be anxious. I also recommend this to students who have an archive phobia or for students who want to go to the archives but feel they have no reason to/extra time.
I would recommend the course to anyone interested in learning about archival research.
I think that I would not recommend this course. It seemed to lack a specific focus and was too spread-out over too wide a range of materials.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Professor Kaplan let me work on a mystifying figure from my field whose rare book the Beinecke happens to have. This person will probably figure into my dissertation--so this was tremendously helpful.
The course has helped me develop my research skills, which will be important in my future research.
